question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Struct: IndexerGrpcCacheWorkerConfig] [Send/Sync Bounds] Are the Send and Sync trait bounds properly enforced to prevent data races when config is shared across threads? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Tokio Runtime] Does the async execution depend on specific Tokio runtime configuration that could cause deadlocks or panics if misconfigured? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Struct: IndexerGrpcCacheWorkerConfig] [Environment Variable Injection] Can environment variables be used to override critical security settings (Redis credentials, fullnode address) allowing privilege escalation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Struct: IndexerGrpcCacheWorkerConfig] [Configuration Reload] If configuration is reloaded at runtime, are there race conditions where old and new configs are mixed causing inconsistent behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Fullnode Impersonation] Can an attacker set fullnode_grpc_address to an impersonation server that serves valid-looking but malicious transaction data, poisoning the cache? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Cache Poisoning] If redis_main_instance_address is compromised, can poisoned cache entries propagate to dependent services causing state inconsistencies across the indexer infrastructure? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [File Store Tampering] Can an attacker modify file store contents while the worker is running, causing version mismatches between cache and file store leading to data corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Denial of Service] Can an attacker trigger repeated failures in Worker::new() or worker.run() to keep the cache worker in a crash loop, denying indexer service availability? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Resource Exhaustion] Does the worker implement rate limiting or backoff to prevent resource exhaustion when processing extremely high transaction volumes from fullnode_grpc_address? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Connection Storms] If multiple cache workers start simultaneously, can connection storms to Redis or fullnode cause cascading failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Transaction Ordering] Does the worker maintain strict ordering guarantees when writing to cache, or can out-of-order processing cause transaction version inconsistencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Atomic Cache Updates] Are cache updates atomic with file store updates, or can partial failures create inconsistent state between cache and persistent storage? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Version Gaps] Can network interruptions or worker restarts create gaps in cached transaction versions that break indexer query consistency? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_server_name()] [Audit Logging] Is the server name used in audit logs, and if so, can it be spoofed to hide malicious activity? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Metrics Collection] Are security-relevant metrics (failed authentications, malformed requests, connection attempts) properly collected for threat detection? (Low)
